channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Fridge and chest of drawers have been dumped, 24th July
item.description:
The fridge has been here for months and the chest of drawers for weeks. They have just been dumped next to the bins but clearly not arranged to be collected as large waste.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Trinity School Lane, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes of various sizes littler the road to the Vinyard farm, 24th July
item.description:
The 3 word location generator gives ///knitted.limit.birthdays Past the valley View house the potholes of various size extend to and past the cattle grid allocated
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cirencester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree Overhanging Property and branches fallen on car, 24th July
item.description:
Tree is overhanging private property, causing a loss of light and branches fallen onto car parked on private driveway. About three weeks ago council contractors cut the trees shorter branches that were fine and ignored the overhanging larger branches higher up. They left dead wood and within a week of them leaving we have large branches falling onto the footpath, road and a private driveway.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellington Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 24th July
item.description:
A tree branch has been knocked by a large sided vehicle and the branch is now broken and remains in the canopy. Please can this be looked at.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Between 23+25 around BT manhole, 24th July
item.description:
This work was completed in our road yesterday. Laying pipes for BT. But this manhole is now an accident waiting to happen. It is very sunken. Lethal to anyone on the pavement, walking, using zimmers or wheelchairs.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakfield Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builders cars and vans blocking pavement daily, 24th July
item.description:
At Shire cars building site at the Shurdington end of Leckhampton Lane. Pavement blocked daily. Very hazardous for pedestrians when there is an empty car park on the main road at the George V playing field. This problems has been going on for at least 2 months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Speed and no large Lorrie’s sign unreadable, 23rd July
item.description:
The signs as you come into Uckington have faded and are unreadable. Please can they be replaced as these are leading to large vehicles coming through the village. Diversions are soon to be put in place on other roads which could lead to more traffic through Uckington and Elmstone Hardwicke so signs are needed asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign plate is missing (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: Road signs faded and unreadable, 23rd July
item.description:
On the entrance to Elmstone Hardwicke the signs including no Lorrie’s/Trucks over a certain tonnage are faded and unreadable. The road continues to Uckington which has its own signs that area also faded - I will report those separately.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Aggressive cows, 23rd July
item.description:
Field next to St Paul’s Church in Leckhampton on the Church Lane in Cheltenham. Field next to it has a Cotswold Way Walk for public right of way through the field. It goes up towards Leckhampton Hill
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
